unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: The Lower Bound
question_text: Given the mean of the sampling distribution for a slope is $4.6$ , the standard error for the slope of a regression line is $1.2$ , and the critical value for the confidence interval for this slope is $2.000$ , find the lower bound of the $95\%$ confidence interval and state what it means.

choices.text: 7.8 7.8 We are 95 % 95 % confident that the true slope will not be less than this number.
7.0 7.0 We are 95 % 95 % confident that the true slope will always be greater than this number.
5.8 5.8 We are 95 % 95 % confident that the true slope will not be less than this number.
3.4 3.4 We are 95 % 95 % confident that the true slope will always be greater than this number.
2.2 2.2 We are 95 % 95 % confident that the true slope will not be less than this number.
